definitions.definition: having or showing fine personal qualities that people admire, such as courage, honesty and care for others

examples.text: He died for a noble cause.
She died in a noble cause.
It was very noble of you to go so far to take him home.

definitions.definition: belonging to a family of high social rank (= belonging to the nobility)

examples.text: He was a young man of noble birth.
one of the noblest families in Portugal
Intermarriage between the noble families means that all the counts are related.

definitions.definition: very impressive in size or quality

wordOrigin: Middle English: from Old French, from Latin (g)nobilis ‘noted, high-born’, from an Indo-European root shared by know.
